reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff here was SO kind and helpful. It was our first time in Dusseldorf, and they helped us with maps and even lent us an umbrella so we could venture out in the rain. The internet in the hotel lobby was fast and free, the room was large and perfectly adequate, although not new, everything was very clean and well cared for. The breakfast was GREAT! A wonderful assortment of hot and cold foods, one of the best hotel breakfasts I've ever seen. I am still raving about the chocolate granola cereal and wish we had it in the US. I would stay there again in a heartbeat. Thanks for making our stay in Dusseldorf a pleasant one.
reviews.title: Wonderful staff, great breakfast, great place to stay!
absolutely wonderful

Small hotel with relatively basic rooms with very friendly service and all the facilities you would look for. Free Internet, good breakfast spread included in room rate, self-service food and drink bar at reasonable prices, located in between the station and the old town. 10 mins walk to Koenigstrasse or the train station, and maybe 15 mins to the old town.
reviews.title: Basic well-priced and well-located hotel with great service.

reviews.text: And, at a price of €44 per night weekend rate, no complaints at all!
reviews.title: AA+ Hotel choice

reviews.text: Could not possibly be nicer. No, it's not a 5-star luxury place but, then, it doesn't charge those prices either. Value for dollar, you cannot beat the Bellevue. Room was fine: clean, comfortable bed, bigger than I am used to for a single room in German hotels. It's not air conditioned, but you can open two large windows and they have an oscillating fan in the room. Free coffee available 24/7. Free wireless internet access. Typical German hotel bathroom: absolutely spotless. Some of those luxury 5-star places could take lessons from the staff of the Bellevue. Speak excellent English, friendly, helpful, etc. I reported that I had a flickering light bulb in the desk lamp and it was replaced within 15 minutes! Large, nice breakfast room. Scrambled eggs and sausages, variety of rolls, juice, fresh fruit, dry cereals, etc. Close to the central train station; maybe a 20-minute walk to the Altstadt.
reviews.title: Excellent value

reviews.text: I stayed one night at the Hotel Bellvue while traveling through Düsseldorf on my way back to the U.S. after 5 nights in a lousy Paris hotel. The Bellvue was refreshing in every aspect: my single room was large by European standards, with a single bed, sitting area, desk, phone, TV, large closet, and private bath. The hotel offered free wifi, which worked without a problem. The staff were friendly and helpful, providing a tourist map and walking directions to Konigsallee and Altstadt (shopping and restaurant districts, respectively). They were about a 20 minute walk away.
reviews.title: Stunning value for money

reviews.text: The hotel itself is a 5 minute walk from the main train station, which makes it convenient whether flying or traveling by train. From the airport terminal, you can take the S7 train to the main train station in about 15 minutes.
